intro: Actinostemon concolor var. caribaeus, commonly known as the Caribbean starflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping in warm climates.
